result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimani L Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kimani L Robinson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 10-23-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kimani L Robinson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the Court by the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms.

As to Count 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for 3 days served.

As to Count 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for Zero days served.

As to both counts:
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- Court ordered 20 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department. (10 days as to each count)
- Attend and successfully complete a Batterers Intervention Program
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
- Absolute Sobriety
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- No contact with the victim - agent may modify if treatment completed and victim approves
- Obtain/Maintain employment 
- Pay all costs, fees, assesssments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 10-23-2015

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Request for expungement - for reasons stated on the record is denied.

Defendant Kimani L Robinson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
Request for payment of * witness fees for witness Jasmine B. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request  x26209217 in court 1x on 6/1/15

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgments of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Kimani L Robinson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1),968.075(1)(a), a Class B Misdemanor.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancer, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kimani L Robinson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  State is ready to proceed without a citizen witness.  Defense has just received discovery and would like an adjournment.  Court granted the request.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40. Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Jury trial scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered 10021 W Fond du Lac removed from the no contact order.

Defendant Kimani L Robinson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/15/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
No contact with Jasmine B.  No possession or attempt to possess a firearm or dangerous weapons.
Statements made by Jasmine B.  Court denied the request to amend the no contact order.

Defendant Kimani L Robinson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  No dangerous weapons.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JASMINE B. AND THE ENTIRE BUILDING OF 10021 W FOND DU LAC AVE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kimani L Robinson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Kimani L Robinson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
